Milan CEO Ivan Gazidis will reportedly meet with Zlatan Ibrahimovic this week, to illustrate his plans for the Rossoneri and try to convince the Swedish star.
個鳩頭佬唔驚比人塞入垃圾筒咩

AC Milan have nine players on contracts which are set to expire in the next 15 months, with a number of difficult decision for the club to make.

Wednesday’s edition of il Corriere dello Sport (via MilanLive) takes a look at each player in question, starting with the five who are on deal which will run out this coming June.

The first name on the list is Zlatan Ibrahimovic. His important to Milan since his return cannot be understated, and the paper claims that a meeting is on the cards between the Swedish striker and CEO Ivan Gazidis to understand the player’s intentions. Ibra for his part will need assurances after the dismissal of Boban.

Giacomo Bonaventura is unlikely to renew his current deal as the club is divided between those who want to offer his fresh terms and those who don’t. Mino Raiola is looking at other options for his client, such as Napoli and Lazio, meaning Bonaventura’s time at San Siro could be up after over half a decade.

Then there are the three January reinforcements: Asmir Begovic, Simon Kjaer and Alex Saelemaekers. The first has little chance of remaining with the Rossoneri, while Kjaer appears to be playing to convince the leaders that his €2.5million option to buy is worth it. Saelemaekers though appears unlikely to have his option to buy triggered.

Moving on to 2021, the issue regarding Gianluigi Donnarumma looms above all. So far, Raiola has always spoken directly to Boban and the Croatian’s farewell could complicate Milan’s plans. Now Gazidis will have to handle the delicate negotiation, and Raiola wants a pay rise for his client that Elliott are highly unlikely to agree to.

Then there are three other names to evaluate for next year: Mateo Musacchio, Ante Rebic and Hakan Calhanoglu. The first will be sold this summer for the right offer having slipped down the pecking order, while Turkish and German clubs are in for Calhanoglu and for the Croatian striker a lot will depend on the coming months.

Ralf Rangnick is ready to snub the agreement he has with AC Milan’s owners Elliott Management over a role at the club, a report claims.

Multiple outlets have reported that the German will take over from both Stefano Pioli and Ricky Massara, ensuing a role unprecedented in Italian football as a head coach and sporting director in one.

However, another twist has arrived. According to what Sky in Germany are reporting, Rangnick ‘will not switch to Milan for the time being’ and ‘a possible deal is unlikely to come about’.

The report claims that there was likely a general agreement between Rangnick and the Milan ownership Elliott Management, but the current Red Bull Head of Football is now unlikely to accept the role as sporting director and head coach.

After his dismissal on Saturday, Zvonimir Boban spoke in an interview with Il Giornale during which he claimed that an agreement had been reached some time ago.

“You made a deal with Rangnick in December,” he said.

However, Rangnick responded to this rumour in a defiant way on Sunday, stating: “This is definitely not true.”

新冠疫情對歐洲足球聯賽的影響越來越大，意甲，西甲，法甲等都採取了相應的的措施，
唯獨英超還穩如泰山。如今，英國方面也坐不住了。

《太陽報》的報導稱，英國聯賽計畫從下周開始空場進行，最快明天就將開始執行，
本賽季不會推遲，將進行到底，採用空場比賽被認為是最好的方式。來自《泰晤士報》的
報導也表示，本賽季剩餘比賽不會推遲，但包括英超在內的英格蘭所有等級的聯賽全部空
場進行。所有季票持有者和購買門票的球迷都可以通過線上觀看比賽。酒吧不允許轉播比
賽，避免人員聚集。當地時間週六下午3點不直播英超比賽。

此前《郵報》的報導稱，英足總不願意取消比賽或者採取空場的方式比賽，因為每場
比賽會損失300萬鎊鉅款。如今疫情嚴重，他們願意接受空場的方式，但是仍不考慮取消
或者推遲賽季，仍希望能夠按時完賽，將損失降低到最小。

【Now Sports】祖雲達斯前鋒迪巴拿和女友Oriana Sabatini本以為已從新型冠狀病毒中痊癒，誰知在最新一次檢測後發現再次呈陽性反應。

迪巴拿（Paulo Dybala）和Oriana Sabatini早前感染了新型冠狀病毒，兩人於數天前宣佈已經再沒有出現病徵，不再需要自我隔離。

不過，Oriana最近透露，她跟迪巴拿原來仍然未康復：「我們在3月21日的檢測結果屬陽性，3天前再測試則是陰性，但做第3次檢測後發現又是陽性，即是說我仍然帶有新型冠狀病毒，我不知道為甚麼。」由於病毒的檢測結果反覆，Oriana呼籲大家有必要至少自我隔離2星期。

事實上，迪巴拿早前已表示感覺好多了：「我一開始咳嗽得厲害，覺得人很疲憊，睡覺的時候覺得很冷。起初我沒有想過自己是甚麼情況，但同樣的症狀在其他兩名隊友身上也出現了，我是最後一個。」

Milan can spend up to 75 million euros on summer reinforcements.

- uncertain future, may leave: Mateo Musacchio, Lucas Paqueta

- possible transfers: Arkadiusz Milik (valuation: 40 million euros), Florentino (exchange with Lucas Paqueta)

- unlikely transfers: Ivan Rakitić (earns too much: 13 million euros net per season)

[La Gazzetta dello Sport]

AC Milan have prioritized the signing of AZ Alkmaar defensive midfielder Teun Koopmeiners, the new van Bommel of Netherlands.

One of the names that AC Milan have identified recently as a top transfer target is Teun Koopmeiners. A player that head scout Geoffrey Moncada has followed on several occasion and seems fully convinced by his potential.

The 22-year-old Dutchman is the captain of AZ Alkmaar who are battling against Ajax for the Eredivisie title this season. His numbers are simply exceptional. Despite being a defensive midfielder Koopmeiners has a keen eye for goal scoring 16 goals and creating 3 in 42 appearances games between the league and cups. Fantastic performances that have attracted the interest of AC Milan.

Koopmeiners in AZ Alkmaar’s 4-2-1-3 formation is one of the two defensive midfielders. He can also play as the central pivot in a midfield of three. If necessary he can even play as a central defender, as he has done in the team’s last three games in Eredivisie. In fact Teun Koopmeiners started his career as centre back.

1 meter and 83 centimeters tall, the left-footed midfielder has characteristics that would be very useful for AC Milan. He knows how to combine quality and quantity, in Holland he is considered a sort of new Mark van Bommel, a footballer who in the past dressed the Rossoneri jersey.

Koopmeiners guarantees determination, speed, physical strength, geometry passes and ball recovery. The Netherlands U-21 is a great free kick taker while on his penalty kicks are guaranteed goals scoring 14 from a total of 15. Despite his young age Koopmeiners is a true leader. He is not only the captain of AZ Alkmaar but also of Netherlands U-21.

Teun has a contract with AZ Alkmaar until June 2023. AZ rate the Dutch midfielder at around €15 million. He can be a good transfer opportunity for AC Milan who must move quickly to avoid the competition of other European clubs. Among these, Red Bull Leipzig, which tried to sign him in January. Ralf Rangnick and his collaborators know Koopmeiners well.

AC Milan chief scout Geoffrey Moncada has picked out two major targets for the club that he wishes to pursue in the upcoming window, a report claims.

According to the latest from Calciomercato.com, Moncada is leading the way in terms of Milan’s recruitment for the summer, and he has earmarked two main targets.

The outlet claims that the two big dreams of the ex-Monaco scout are Luka Jovic and Mario Gotze of Real Madrid and Borussia Dortmund respectively.

The most concrete and attainable objective at this point remains Dominik Szoboszlai of Red Bull Salzburg, but Lazio remain ahead in the race.

It has been reported by the same outlets that Milan are readying a €40m bid to sign Jovic, who has struggled at Real Madrid since his €60m arrival at the Bernabeu from Bundesliga side Eintracht Frankfurt last summer.

Meanwhile, Gotze is out of contract at the end of the season and would be available on a free, and is believe to be keen on moving to Italy due to his partner’s job as a model.

Between them, the pair have combined for 83 goals in 283 Bundesliga appearances.

According to Tuesday’s edition of the newspaper La Repubblica (via Calciomercato.com) though, there are five key points that Milan must agree with and adhere to if the German is to accept a new challenge in Italy.

Rangnick wants full powers for five years over the market and the direction of recruitment as one point, plus a €140million revolution internally with 18-20 new staff members.

He wants to implement a unique tactical philosophy and wants a budget of around €75-80million for the summer transfer window, in which he must be allowed to sign players with an average age of 22.

AC Milan's restructuring of their management team has taken a fresh twist.

While Red Bull chief Ralf Rangnick has declared he is in talks about moving to Milan, it's emerged he won't be arriving as coach.

Instead, Gazzetta dello Sport says Rangnick will arrive as technical director and will take charge of all levels of the club, from the first team down to the juniors.

As such, a new coach will have to be found and RB Leipzig boss Julian Nagelsmann is a target.

Nagelsmann moved from Hoffenheim to RBL last summer, following a similar career path to Rangnick.

Lucas Paqueta’s future is destined to be far away from AC Milan. The Brazilian midfielder, who has a contract until 2023 with the Rossoneri, has failed to impress and now the search for a buyer is ongoing.

As reported by Calciomercato.com, Paqueta isn’t well suited for the tactics that Ralf Rangnick wants to implement at Milan for next season. Therefore, they are likely to part ways in the summer.

Furthermore, given his age and potential, there are still suitors on the market. Milan invested €35m in the player in January of last year and there is now a chance to make a small capital gain, while he could also be offered in swap deals.

For this reason, among the hypotheses on the table, Milan are more inclined to favour the one that would bring Paqueta to Benfica in exchange for Florentino Luis. Fiorentina are also interested but their offer hasn’t attracted the Rossoneri’s interest.

However, there is an obstacle in the negotiations with Benfica as they value their youngster at €45m and Paqueta at €30m. Therefore, Milan need to convince the Portuguese side to lower their claims for the 20-year-old.

Borussia Monchengladbach boss Marco Rose is reportedly on Milan’s shortlist to take over if Ralf Rangnick or Julian Nagelsmann do not.

Rangnick has yet to decide on whether he will join Milan as their technical director or an English-style manager with full control over coaching and recruitment.

Tuttosport claims they are ‘hopeful’ of the Red Bull chief agreeing to the latter but, in the event he does not, he would be entrusted with sourcing a coach.

Assuming Stefano Pioli is on his way out, the newspaper writes Rose is being considered alongside Nagelsmann.

The 43-year-old is well-known to Rangnick, having guided Red Bull Salzburg to consecutive Austrian titles between 2017 and 2019.

He moved to Monchengladbach last summer and has since taken them to third in Bundesliga, only behind Bayern Munich and Borussia Dortmund.
